content_text: Everything available in our environment which can be used to satisfy our needs, provided, it is technologically accessible, economically feasible and culturally acceptable can be termed as 'Resource'.

Basis|Types|Examples
Origin|Biotic, Abiotic|Flora/Fauna, Rocks/Metals
Exhaustibility|Renewable, Non-Renewable|Solar/Wind, Coal/Petroleum
Ownership|Individual, Community, National, International|Plots/Houses, Parks, Roads, Oceans
Status|Potential, Developed, Stock, Reserve|Wind(Gujarat), Coal Mines, Water(H2), Dams

graph TD
    A[Identification and Inventory] --> B[Evolving Planning Structure]
    B --> C[Matching with National Plans]
    A --> D[Surveying and Mapping]
    A --> E[Qualitative and Quantitative Estimation]
    B --> F[Technology and Skill]
    C --> G[Overall Development]
Sustainable economic development means 'development should take place without damaging the environment'.
Gandhiji said: 'There is enough for everybody's need and not for any body's greed.'
